description: The authorities are working to identify the dozens of victims, who are believed to be migrants. Four people have been charged with crimes.
title: What We Know About the Migrant Deaths in San Antonio
title_page: What We Know About the Migrant Deaths in San Antonio - The New York Times
maintext:
Authorities in Texas are investigating the deaths of 53 people after they were discovered inside or near a tractor-trailer in San Antonio on Monday, one of the highest death tolls involving migrants crossing into the United States.
Federal investigators are working with local and state police to identify the victims. Four people have been charged with crimes.
Here is what we know so far.
The investigation is continuing.
The mayor of San Antonio, Ron Nirenberg, called the deaths a “horrific human tragedy” at a news conference on Monday evening.
The truck did not have a functioning cooling system, officials said, leaving those secreted inside sweltering as outside temperatures soared above 100 degrees on Monday. Some people died after being taken to hospitals.
